page.title: 11Home life, Fun 50 Years Ago
page.content: There was not as much entertainment then as there was today. There was a Dance Hall near the harbour. People amused themselves by playing penny machines & looking at machines called "What The Butler Saw." They showed pictures of sexy men & women. There were also telescopes along the sea-front & for 1d you could look through them for 1 minute. At this time there was no Punch & Judy show. There was a bandstand on the cliff where military bands played popular songs & excerpts from operas. Ice-creams were 1/2d & 1d each. There was no candy floss or popcorn but seaside rock & candy was cheap. William Fleming was a life-boat man, who after retirement gave tourists trips in his boats.
